required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reducing Wrinkles Around the Eyes Using the Ulthera® System
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Ulthera® System for Obtaining a Reduction of Wrinkles Around the Eyes

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this prospective, multi-center, single treatment study is to evaluate the clinical outcomes associated with the non-invasive treatment to reduce wrinkles around the eyes utilizing the Ulthera® System to deliver focused ultrasound energy below the surface of the skin.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of this clinical trial is to demonstrate the effectiveness of the Ulthera® System for non-invasive treatment to reduce wrinkles around the eyes.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Improvement in Periorbital Wrinkles and Rhytids Around the Eyes
primary_outcome.description: Improvement in periorbital skin laxity and rhytids as determined by masked assessor review of photographs at 90days post-treatment compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Periorbital Wrinkles and Rhytids Around the Eyes at 60 Days Post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: At 60 days post-treatment, each site investigator and each subject completed a Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS), comparing with pre-treatment photos. The GAIS is 5-point scale (1-5) describing an overall assessment as follows: = Very Much Improved = Much Improved = Improved = No Change = Worse "Any Improvement" includes subjects assessed in categories 1-3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Periorbital Wrinkles and Rhytids Around the Eyes at 90 Days Post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: At 90 days post-treatment, each site investigator and each subject completed a Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS), comparing with pre-treatment photos. The GAIS is 5-point scale (1-5) describing an overall assessment as follows: = Very Much Improved = Much Improved = Improved = No Change = Worse "Any Improvement" includes subjects assessed in categories 1-3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Periorbital Wrinkles and Rhytids Around the Eyes at 180 Days Post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: At 180 days post-treatment, each site investigator and each subject completed a Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS), comparing with pre-treatment photos. The GAIS is 5-point scale (1-5) describing an overall assessment as follows: = Very Much Improved = Much Improved = Improved = No Change = Worse "Any Improvement" includes subjects assessed in categories 1-3.
Subject satisfaction determined by scores on a patient satisfaction questionnaire at 90 days post-treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Satisfaction Questionnaire at 180 Days Post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Subject satisfaction determined by scores on a patient satisfaction questionnaire at 180 days post-treatment.

other_outcome.time_frame: Average pain scores reported during study treatment
other_outcome.description: Subjects' sensory responses to the treatment exposures were recorded for each anatomical region treated using a validated Numeric Rating Scale, 0-10, where 0 = no pain and 10 = worse pain possible.

arm_group.description: Ulthera treatment to the upper face.

intervention.description: Focused ultrasound energy delivered below the surface of the skin.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, aged 30 to 65 years.
- Subject in good health.
- Mild to moderate rhytids in the periorbital region.
- Willingness and ability to comply with protocol requirements and return for follow-up visits.
- Not pregnant.
- Provide written informed consent and HIPAA authorization.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of an active systemic or local skin disease that may affect wound healing.
- Severe solar elastosis.
- Excessive subcutaneous fat in the face.
- Deep wrinkles, numerous lines, with or without redundant skin in the area to be treated.
- Excessive hooding, with or without redundant skin, in the areas to be treated.
- Significant scarring in areas to be treated.
- Significant open facial wounds or lesions.
- Severe or cystic acne on the face.
- Presence of a metal stent or implant in the facial area to be treated.

overall_official.affiliation: The Nashville Centre for Laser and Facial Surgery

facility.name: The Nashville Centre for Laser and Facial Surgery

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Sixty-eight subjects were enrolled at two aesthetic medical facilities. Study recruitment was initiated on March 3, 2011, and concluded on July 13, 2011. Forty-five subjects were enrolled at one study site; 23 subjects were enrolled at the second study site.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects presenting with rhytids and skin laxity in the periorbital region, Fitzpatrick Wrinkle Classification Scale (FWCS)of 3 to 7, qualified for study participation. Note: A protocol amendment restricting enrollment to FWCS scores of 3-7 occurred after 19 subjects with FWCS = 2 had been enrolled.

group.title: Treated Subjects
group.description: The FWCS, a 9 point scale used to classify wrinkle severity, was used to qualify subjects for study participation. Score 1-3 = Fine wrinkles; 4-6 = Fine to moderate-depth wrinkles, moderate number of lines; 7-9 = Fine to deep wrinkles, Numerous lines with or without redundant skin folds. All study subjects received an Ulthera treatment to the upper face.

baseline.population: Adults between 30 and 65 years of age who provided informed consent and who met the inclusion/exclusion criteria and required infraorbital, lateral orbit, and brow regions to be treated bilaterally.

group.title: Treated Subjects
group.description: All study subjects received an Ulthera treatment to the upper face.

measure.title: Fitzpatrick Skin Type
measure.description: Skin Type I = White;very fair,red or blonde hair blue eyes;freckles;Always burns, never tans Skin Type II = White, fair, red or blond hair; blue, hazel or green eyes;Usually burns, tans with difficulty Skin Type III = Cream white; fair with any eye or hair color (common); Sometimes mild burn, gradually tans Skin Type IV = Brown; typical Mediterranean Caucasian skin; Rarely burns, tans with ease Skin Type V = Dark Brown; mid-eastern skin types; Very rarely burns, tans easily Skin Type VI = Black; Never burns, tans very easily

outcome.title: Overall Improvement in Periorbital Wrinkles and Rhytids Around the Eyes
outcome.description: Improvement in periorbital skin laxity and rhytids as determined by masked assessor review of photographs at 90days post-treatment compared to baseline.
outcome.population: Primary endpoint: Three masked assessors reviewed pre- and 90 days post-treatment photos, assessing each eye separately. 41 right, 42 left eye photos were found to be usable. Photos excluded had photographic lighting, focus and exposure inconsistencies obscuring key physical details making pre- vs. post-treatment photo comparisons impossible.

group.title: Subjects Treated
group.description: All study subjects received an Ulthera treatment to the upper face.

measure.title: Overall Improvement in Periorbital Wrinkles and Rhytids Around the Eyes
measure.description: Improvement in periorbital skin laxity and rhytids as determined by masked assessor review of photographs at 90days post-treatment compared to baseline.
measure.population: Primary endpoint: Three masked assessors reviewed pre- and 90 days post-treatment photos, assessing each eye separately. 41 right, 42 left eye photos were found to be usable. Photos excluded had photographic lighting, focus and exposure inconsistencies obscuring key physical details making pre- vs. post-treatment photo comparisons impossible.

outcome.title: Improvement in Periorbital Wrinkles and Rhytids Around the Eyes at 60 Days Post-treatment
outcome.description: At 60 days post-treatment, each site investigator and each subject completed a Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS), comparing with pre-treatment photos. The GAIS is 5-point scale (1-5) describing an overall assessment as follows: = Very Much Improved = Much Improved = Improved = No Change = Worse "Any Improvement" includes subjects assessed in categories 1-3.
outcome.population: At 60 days, the PI and subject completed a GAIS (PGAIS and SGAIS, respectively)for comparison to pre-treatment.

group.title: Subjects Treated
group.description: All study subject received an Ulthera treatment to the upper face.

measure.title: Improvement in Periorbital Wrinkles and Rhytids Around the Eyes at 60 Days Post-treatment
measure.description: At 60 days post-treatment, each site investigator and each subject completed a Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS), comparing with pre-treatment photos. The GAIS is 5-point scale (1-5) describing an overall assessment as follows: = Very Much Improved = Much Improved = Improved = No Change = Worse "Any Improvement" includes subjects assessed in categories 1-3.
measure.population: At 60 days, the PI and subject completed a GAIS (PGAIS and SGAIS, respectively)for comparison to pre-treatment.

class.title: PGAIS - Improved to Very Much Improved
SGAIS - Improved to Very Much Improved

outcome.title: Improvement in Periorbital Wrinkles and Rhytids Around the Eyes at 90 Days Post-treatment
outcome.description: At 90 days post-treatment, each site investigator and each subject completed a Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS), comparing with pre-treatment photos. The GAIS is 5-point scale (1-5) describing an overall assessment as follows: = Very Much Improved = Much Improved = Improved = No Change = Worse "Any Improvement" includes subjects assessed in categories 1-3.
outcome.population: Data analysis was based on participants who completed a Subject Global Aesthetic Improvement scale (SGAIS) and were assessed by a study investigator via completion of a Physician Global Aesthetic Improvement scale (PGAIS)at 90 days post-treatment, per protocol.

outcome.title: Patient Satisfaction Questionnaire 90 Days Post-treatment
outcome.description: Subject satisfaction determined by scores on a patient satisfaction questionnaire at 90 days post-treatment.
outcome.population: Data analyzed included subjects completing a 90 day visit and a questionnaire assessing treatment satisfaction, comparing pre-treatment and day 90 post-treatment photographic images. Responses were tabulated.

group.title: Subjects Treated
group.description: All study subjects received an Ulthera treatment to the upper face.

measure.title: Patient Satisfaction Questionnaire 90 Days Post-treatment
measure.description: Subject satisfaction determined by scores on a patient satisfaction questionnaire at 90 days post-treatment.
measure.population: Data analyzed included subjects completing a 90 day visit and a questionnaire assessing treatment satisfaction, comparing pre-treatment and day 90 post-treatment photographic images. Responses were tabulated.

outcome.title: Patient Satisfaction Questionnaire at 180 Days Post-treatment
outcome.description: Subject satisfaction determined by scores on a patient satisfaction questionnaire at 180 days post-treatment.
outcome.population: Data analyzed included subjects completing a 180 day visit and a questionnaire assessing treatment satisfaction, comparing pre-treatment and day 180 post-treatment photographic images. Responses were tabulated. 60 of 61 subjects provided responses. One subject's response was missing.

group.title: Treated Subjects
group.description: All study subjects received an Ulthera treatment to the upper face.

measure.title: Patient Satisfaction Questionnaire at 180 Days Post-treatment

Responses were tabulated. 60 of 61 subjects provided responses. One subject's response was missing.

outcome.title: Subject Assessment of Pain
outcome.description: Subjects' sensory responses to the treatment exposures were recorded for each anatomical region treated using a validated Numeric Rating Scale, 0-10, where 0 = no pain and 10 = worse pain possible.
outcome.time_frame: Average pain scores reported during study treatment
outcome.population: The subjects' sensory responses to the treatment exposures were recorded for each anatomical region treated, using a validated numeric rating scale of 0-10 with 1 representing no pain and 10 representing the highest degree of pain.

group.title: Treated Subjects
group.description: All study subjects received an Ulthera treatment to the upper face.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: FWCS scores assessed globally, not per eye, leading to limited data for analysis. FWCS protocol amended to 3+ after enrollment of 19 subjects with FWCS of 2. Unacceptable lighting, focus, exposure making some photos impossible to evaluate.
